Name: Assembla
Cost: 15-day free trial. Commercial projects with customizable sets of tools and features.

Name: Bitbucket
Cost: Free private repositories are limited to 5 users

Name: Freepository
Cost: Gratis accounts have web access only.

Name: GitHub
Cost: Gratis for public, paid for private.

Name: GitLab
Developed and/or used CDE: GitLab Community Edition (CE) free software, GitLab Enterprise Edition (EE) proprietary
Cost: Unlimited public and private repos, unlimited public and private collaborators

Name: Gitorious
Notes: Acquired by GitLab. gitorious.org will shut down end of May 2015

Name: Gna!
Notes: Only for free software projects. Code access review

Name: GNOME Git Repositories
Notes: Accessing this resource is only granted to developers requesting explicit permission to existing GNOME module maintainers. Repositories hosted here should match the prerequisites listed at
Cost: Gratis, but limited to a set of pre-approved developers, see Notes.

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Project by the Free Software Foundation and projects with a GPL compatible license. Code access review

Name: Google Code
Countries blocked: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Supports only Bazaar for version-controlled repository hosting.

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: For free software, free culture and free knowledge projects.

Name: SourceForge
Countries blocked: Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria
Cost: Gratis, commercial services are offered as well

Name: Tigris.org
Notes: Restricted to collaborative software development tools. Tigris.org is no longer accepting new project proposals.

Name: Assembla
Notes: GXUnit, Hikarunix, HippoMocks, MadSwatter, SnakeYAML, Scala IDE

Name: BerliOS
Notes: aMule, avidemux, SuperTux, LinCity-NG (before shutdown of BerliOS)

Name: CodePlex
Notes: ASP.NET MVC Framework, Entity Framework, IronPython, Cosmos , PCSX-Reloaded

Name: GitHub
Notes: Ruby on Rails, IronRuby, jQuery, Moodle, Diaspora, node.js, NumPy, Spring Framework, PHP, Play Framework, Scala, SciPy, PPSSPP, Dolphin (emulator), HDNes, PCSX2, phpMyAdmin, Poedit, ReactOS, Retroarch, Nestopia, RPCS3, Xenia, Whonix

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Most GNU projects (including Emacs), QEMU, GNU IceCat

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Ubuntu, MySQL (code hosting), BlueBream (Zope 3) (bug tracking), Inkscape, Bazaar, GNOME Do, Drizzle, Launchpad, LiVES (translations)

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: Hispanic Critical Mass movement, the Kune federated collaborative social network, the P2P Foundation workgroup, plenty of non-software free culture initiatives

Name: SourceForge
Notes: Inkscape (download hosting), LAME, MinGW, 7-Zip, Fluxbox, Audacity, ffdshow, EMule, FileZilla, LiVES, DeSmuME , BizHawk, Yabause, Mednafen, FCEUX, Nintendulator, Gambatte.

Name: freedesktop.org
Client side: non-free JS code: Only for interoperability and shared base technology for free software desktop environments on Linux and other Unix-like operating systems, including the X Window System (X11) and cairo (graphics).
